page.title: 17Smuggling
page.content: Smuggling had a great impact on the people of Mudeford in C18.To help couteract this men and ships were stationed at Southampton,Cowes and Poole.To counter land smugglers 4 Riding Officers and Supervisor were stationed at Christchurch.During the 'great run'of contraband in July 1784 the master of the 'Orestes'(sloop stationed at Cowes)was shot and later died.The smugglers used Haven House Inn(still standing)to shelter in.A smuggler,George Coombes,was executed for this crime.His body was probably returned to the Haven Quay where it was hung on a gibbett in an iron cage. John Streeter,another smuggler,lived in Stanpit where he ran a snuff factory,smuggling tobacco for this purpose.He was imprisoned at Winchester in 1786 but escaped later recorded as living in Stanpit.
